string-array.name: xxhelp_shoporder_field
string-array.item: &heading;Shop Order Field
The Shop Order is used to specify the Order in which Shops are listed in the Shoppong List.
Shops with lower Orders appear higher in the Shopping List
The Shop City can be up to 24 characters in length.
The Order is a whole number between 1 and 9999.

ShopWise will suggest a number when adding a Shop and will 100 greater than the highest Order (unless the highest number is getting close to the 9999 when it will try to pick a number 10 greater than the highest Order.

string-array.name: help_main_activity
string-array.item: &heading;Main Menu - Help
The Main Menu displays a list of Buttons which can be clicked to take you to the respective option.
The Buttons are dependent upon the data that has been added to the Database.
Initially ShopWise has no data and only the SHOPS, STORAGE and TOOLS buttons are listed.
&tab1;SHOPS is for managing Shops; you can Add, Edit and Delete Shops.
&tab1;STORAGE is for managing Storage Locations. (i.e. where you keep/store items e.g. Pantry).
&tab1;TOOLS take you to an additional Menu of less frequently used options:-
&tab2;BACKUP for backing up and restoring ShopWise\'s data.
&tab2;RULES for creating new rules and amending existing rules base upon historical data.
When at least 1 or more Shops exist, the Aisles button will be listed.
&tab1;AISLES is for managing Aisles; you can Add, Edit and Delete Aisles.
&tab1;An Aisle represents a location in a Shop, it need not be an Aisle, it could be an area, such as Bakery.)
When at least 1 or more Storage Locations exist, the PRODUCTS button will be listed.
&tab1;PRODUCTS, is for managing Products; you can Add, Edit and Delete Products.
&tab1;A Product, is an item that you buy.
When at least 1 Aisle (and therefore Shop) and at least 1 Product (and therefore a Storage Location) exist, the STOCK button will be listed.
&tab1;STOCK allows you to Add, Edit or Delete Stock.
&tab2;Stock is a Product in an Aisle, within a Shop.
&tab2;An analogy is the difference between saying \"get a can of baked beans\"> and saying \"get a can of baked beans from the corner shop\". The latter is more specific.
&tab2; ShopWise doesn\'t allow you to use the former, rather ShopWise relies upon Products that have a location (Shop and Aisle) for the Shopping List. Hence the term Stock.
&tab2;A single Product can be the basis of multiple stocked items.
&tab2;e.g. Baked Beans could be stocked(Stock) in an Aisle of the Shop Corner Shop as well as in an Aisle of the Shop SuperStore.
&tab2;Stock, when assigned also has additional attributes, such as Price, that are specific to that stocked product.
&tab2;You can also invoke the STOCK option from within the SHOPS, AISLES and PRODUCTS options (The help associated with the options covers this).
When at least 1 Stock exists then options, Order, CheckList, <Shopping and Rules are listed (i.e. All Buttons are now Listed).
&tab1;ORDER is for Adding items to the Shopping List in an Ad-Hoc way, according to Stock and thus Product, it compliments CHECKLIST
&tab1;CHECKLIST is for Adding items to the Shopping List in an orderly way by checking the Storage Locations.
&tab1;SHOPPING is for doing the Shopping, it is the Shopping List.
&tab1;RULES is for managing rules that will automatically add to the Shopping List.
